[{"name": "places/ChIJGdo6XIMWrjsR27K3QpD1ZXA/reviews/ChdDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnTUR3X0w2bHJnRRAB", "relativePublishTimeDescription": "3 weeks ago", "rating": 5, "text": {"text": "Exceptional Experience at The Oberoi, Bengaluru

We stayed at the Oberoi from the 22nd March to the 24th March 2025. From the moment we were greeted at the airport, our stay at The Oberoi, Bengaluru was nothing short of exceptional. The staff’s attentiveness and warmth set the tone for what would be a truly memorable experience.

Check-in was smooth and welcoming, thanks to Jonaki at the front desk, whose friendly demeanor and consistent hospitality made us feel instantly at home. A special mention goes to Mr. Prateek from the Food & Beverage team—his thoughtful recommendations for food, restaurants, and shopping were spot-on and added so much value to our visit.

What truly sets The Oberoi apart is the personal touch. Every member of the team—from the doormen and bellboys to housekeeping—went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. We’ve had the privilege of staying at many high-end properties around the world, but none have matched the personalized service and genuine care we experienced here.

Customer service at The Oberoi is truly in a league of its own. Highly recommended for anyone seeking luxury with a heart.", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "Exceptional Experience at The Oberoi, Bengaluru

places.name: Amintiri

[{"name": "places/ChIJI_uzjBcXrjsRYJ-spWNxLYA/reviews/ChZDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnTURJMXVlcEJnEAE", "relativePublishTimeDescription": "in the last week", "rating": 5, "text": {"text": "Amintiri Patisserie, located on Museum Road near MG Road in Bangalore, is a stylish bakery and cafe renowned for its handmade cakes and desserts. Among their standout offerings are the signature pull-up cakes, particularly the Lotus Biscoff Pull-Up cake and the seasonal Mango Pull-Up cake. These cakes are celebrated for their soft, moist texture and rich flavors, making them a favorite among dessert enthusiasts.​
Beyond their delectable desserts, Amintiri offers a cozy ambiance with elegant teal interiors and comfortable seating, including outdoor options. The menu extends to include pasta, sandwiches, pancakes, and more, catering to a variety of tastes. Patrons have praised not only the quality of the food but also the prompt and friendly service, enhancing the overall dining experience. ​", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "Amintiri Patisserie, located on Museum Road near MG Road in Bangalore, is a stylish bakery and cafe renowned for its handmade cakes and desserts. I ordered the veggie burger and Veg Ala King.
The burger was amazing and flavourful. The Veg Ala King was my favourite. It's basically vegetables in white sauce served with a simple rice and garlic bread.

This is a local favourite of the your generation as it's got a youthful crowd.

They have an excellent selection of desserts too.

Given how it has evolved over time, things are bound to change and I was amazed at the variety of global cuisines available just on church street alone!
At one end is Church Street Social, a lovely place to hang out and have a pint. That's exactly what we did too! Being Oktoberfest, there was a sausage snack which we tried that turned out to be quite nice as well. Sadly though, the place was rather quiet given it was late afternoon and things started to pick up as we left early evening.
Now when I said pint, I actually wasn't speaking of beer. What we did have was a Banarasi Patiala drink - essentially a glass of sugar cane juice spiked with 90 ml of you choice (white rum, black rum or vodka). The menu clearly says they can't serve more than 2 drinks per person, which tells you of the kind of kick you stand to get!
Overall, an enjoyable place with a cool vibe with an F1 corner too where you can take pictures with cut-out boards of the F1 drivers, in case you are a fan.
I look forward to visiting early evening onwards when it gets a bit lively and enjoying a drink (or three!) soon enough.", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "Being from Bangalore, I get nostalgic when I think of what Bangalore was like growing up and walking the streets of MG.Road, Brigade Road, Church Street, etc...

At one end is Church Street Social, a lovely place to hang out and have a pint. That's exactly what we did too! Being Oktoberfest, there was a sausage snack which we tried that turned out to be quite nice as well. Sadly though, the place was rather quiet given it was late afternoon and things started to pick up as we left early evening.
Now when I said pint, I actually wasn't speaking of beer. What we did have was a Banarasi Patiala drink - essentially a glass of sugar cane juice spiked with 90 ml of you choice (white rum, black rum or vodka). The menu clearly says they can't serve more than 2 drinks per person, which tells you of the kind of kick you stand to get!
Overall, an enjoyable place with a cool vibe with an F1 corner too where you can take pictures with cut-out boards of the F1 drivers, in case you are a fan.
I look forward to visiting early evening onwards when it gets a bit lively and enjoying a drink (or three!) soon enough.", "languageCode": "en"}, "authorAttribution": {"displayName": "Navin Rao", "uri": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/100737917184890228135/reviews", "photoUri": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU8krIjwRorEsWfZhwJzOFAGW3zU1jgyy7PClXhzJiivh6x0fLt=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5"}, "publishTime": "2024-10-13T07:40:18.260923Z", "flagContentUri": "https://www.google.com/local/review/rap/report?postId=ChdDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnSUNYaE5ia2x3RRAB&d=17924085&t=1", "googleMapsUri": "https://www.google.com/maps/reviews/data=!4m6!14m5!1m4!2m3!1sChdDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnSUNYaE5ia2x3RRAB!2m1!1s0x3bae167c7ba9de6b:0x7ccd21aeaf2063d0"}]

It’s located in a beautiful old building, and the vibe is calm and inviting. Inside, you’ll find a fantastic collection of modern and contemporary Indian art. From stunning paintings to unique sculptures, there’s so much to explore.

What I really love is how well-curated the space is—it’s easy to get lost in the exhibits and appreciate the journey of Indian art over the years. The gallery also has temporary exhibits, so there’s always something new to check out. The staff is friendly and happy to help, which makes the experience even better.

If you enjoy art, this is definitely a place you should visit in Bengaluru. Opened to the public on February 18, 2009, the gallery occupies a 3.5-acre estate that elegantly blends heritage with modernity. The original mansion was thoughtfully converted into a gallery space of 1,551 square meters, complemented by a new wing of 1,260 square meters designed to seamlessly align with the architectural charm of the original building.

The NGMA houses an impressive collection that traces the evolution of modern Indian art. Its exhibits range from Indian miniature paintings and works by colonial artists to masterpieces from the Bengal School and leading post-independence figures, offering insight into the journey of Indian art into the modern and post-modern era. Beyond its permanent collection, the gallery frequently hosts both national and international exhibitions, making it a dynamic space for art lovers and cultural enthusiasts alike.", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "The National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) in Bengaluru is a cultural gem nestled within the serene surroundings of the historic Manikyavelu Mansion on Palace Road. We had a great dining experience at this cafe in Bangalore, with a menu that impressed us with its flavors and variety. We started with Farmhouse and Spiced Tomato Pizza, Corn Bane Angare, and Chapate Cones, all of which were delicious. The pizza had a perfect balance of crispiness and cheesiness, the Corn Bane Angare was flavorful and crunchy, and the Chapate Cones were a unique, tasty surprise.

For the main course, we tried Kakke Di Roti, Siddu Paji Da Paratha, Chur Chur Naan, and Cheesy Bell Pepper Naan, paired with Bandli Mix and Peshwari Kofta. The variety of breads was excellent, and the gravies were rich and flavorful, especially the Peshwari Kofta, which stood out with its creamy texture and well-balanced spices.

We also ordered Parinda, Red Riding Hood, and Husky Watermelon for drinks, and they were refreshing and well-prepared.

While the food was overall delicious, the taste and portion sizes could have been a bit better for the price. The flavors were great, but a little more balance in seasoning would have made it even better.

A solid 4-star experience—great ambiance, delicious food, and a place worth visiting again!", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "Delicious Food with Room for Improvement

The rustic charm of the interiors, combined with a welcoming outdoor seating area, sets the tone for a relaxed outing.

The menu offers a delectable range of baked goods, hearty meals, and indulgent desserts. The red velvet cupcake is a standout, perfectly moist with a luscious frosting. Their wood-fired pizzas and all-day breakfast options are a must-try, offering comfort food at its best.

The coffee is aromatic and pairs beautifully with their desserts. The service is prompt, and the staff are friendly, adding to the overall experience. Whether you're catching up with friends or enjoying a quiet moment with a book, Glen's Bakehouse provides the perfect setting.

**Recommendation:** Don't leave without trying their signature Bakehouse Cheesecake!  And red velvet small cupcakes

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐(5/5)

places.reviews:
[{"name": "places/ChIJhUwCoH4WrjsRXHFQjoJQxzQ/reviews/ChdDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnSURmcmNxMzFBRRAB", "relativePublishTimeDescription": "3 months ago", "rating": 5, "text": {"text": "The Only Place – A Meat Lover’s Paradise on Church Street

If you’re looking for the best steaks and meat-heavy dishes in Bangalore, look no further than The Only Place near Church Street. We visited on a packed Saturday evening and were lucky to get a great table amidst the lively ambiance and fun crowd.

The food was nothing short of spectacular. We ordered their signature lamb chops, chicken lasagna, and the chicken supreme burger. The lamb chops were the absolute highlight—perfectly cooked, incredibly juicy, and so tender that each bite felt like heaven. The lasagna was indulgently cheesy and full of flavor, a true comfort dish that left us wanting more despite being stuffed. The chicken supreme burger was hearty and satisfying, completing an already amazing meal.

The place exudes the charm of old Bangalore, with its tiled roof and open seating area giving off nostalgic vibes.

This restaurant is probably around 45 years old. We met Chandru, who has been working here for the past 40 years. He was very knowledgeable about the food and explained the ingredients in detail, ensuring that what he promised was exactly what was served.

We felt like going back in time to another era. The ambience looks like what Bangalore might have been 15-20 years back.
The food is exceptional. We didn't know any of the house favorites but tried to order based on what people nearby were having 😅
The ham sandwich was a perfect blend of taste and simplicity.
And a mutton cutlet on the breakfast menu will make most Bengali foodies mad with joy.
The mutton stew with freshly prepped appam tasted incredible. Even butter on toast felt special 😋
This is without doubt an awesome breakfast place. The history and heritage are an added bonus.", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "This is an iconic place. We felt like going back in time to another era. The ambience looks like what Bangalore might have been 15-20 years back.
The food is exceptional. We didn't know any of the house favorites but tried to order based on what people nearby were having 😅
The ham sandwich was a perfect blend of taste and simplicity.
And a mutton cutlet on the breakfast menu will make most Bengali foodies mad with joy.

At the time of our visit, the main Koshy’s restaurant on the left side was bustling with people, but the Jewel Box section was completely empty. We ordered Biriyani, Beef Tenderloin Steak with Pineapple, Kulcha, and Butter Chicken (half portion).
•	Kulcha and Butter Chicken were the highlights of the meal. The butter chicken was flavorful, and even the half portion was enough for four people.
•	Biriyani was disappointing, lacking the expected richness and taste.
•	Beef Tenderloin Steak with Pineapple was just okay, nothing exceptional.

The staff seemed to be in a hurry to close the restaurant, which made the experience feel rushed. It was surprising to see this at a place like Koshy’s, which is known for its legacy and service.

But the food, sadly, was a disappointment, doubly so as it was a celebratory dinner.

The Lamb Pizza was a bit chewy and lacked flavour and the Lamb Chops were also lacklustre. We ordered a red wine by the glass and the quantity was barely 1/5 of the glass. Even a fail-safe drink like Chocolate Shake was  a let-down. Overall portions seemed to be small and dishes seemed pricey for the quantity offered.

The place is pet friendly and also has spacious parking. Staff were all helpful and service was decently fast. Mosquitoes in the evening were a nuisance and the incense stick put to help only ended up troubling diners with the smoke.

Can recommend the place for the chill atmosphere only, provided expectations are low for the food.", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "Tucked inside a quiet nook on Cunningham Road, the place has an old world charm. With its old-world charm and serene surroundings, it truly feels like a hidden gem. The cafe is pet-friendly, offering cozy outdoor seating, which adds to its relaxed vibe.

The menu is reasonably priced, especially considering the upscale area it’s located in. We tried the Fish Kabab and Chicken Skewers, both of which were fresh, hot, and absolutely delicious. The Garlic Bread stood out with its unique twist—loaded with veggies and cheese and hand-tossed to perfection. Watching the brick oven in action, as pizzas and garlic bread are prepared, adds a delightful touch to the dining experience.

The Mulled Wine was a highlight, offering a flavor reminiscent of a Bloody Mary. It’s worth noting that the cafe serves only wine (by the bottle) and cocktails, with no other liquor options available.

While the ambiance is calm and inviting, the popularity of the cafe means there’s often a 15-minute wait for larger groups. The bustling crowd and waitlist are a testament to its growing reputation.

Overall, Trippy Goat Cafe is a delightful spot to unwind, enjoy great Italian food, and soak in its charming, pet-friendly atmosphere.", "languageCode": "en"}, "originalText": {"text": "Trippy Goat Cafe is a charming Italian-themed restaurant tucked away in a quiet corner on Cunningham Road. I like the aesthetics of the space and calming environment around, esp. when you sit outdoors (but loads of pesky flies to annoy you)

We ordered fish cakes, potato salad and shimp tacos along with a mimosa and a sangria.

The Sangria was ok, I think our first reaction was where are the fruits? Lol. The mimosa was must better tasting.

The tacos and fish cakes looked great and tasted good too. We assumed the salad to be mayo/yogurt forward with loads of potatoes bits, but here it was a green salad with potato fritters. It was not bad though.

One of the highlights was the minimal waiting time, which was a pleasant surprise as the café wasn’t crowded during my visit. This made the whole experience smooth and stress-free.

The staff were polite and attentive, ensuring that everything was taken care of promptly. It’s always nice to have courteous service, and the team at Cafe Azzure didn’t disappoint.

The café accepts EazyDiner payments, which was convenient. However, it’s worth noting that they don’t accept Magicpin payments, so plan accordingly if you rely on that platform.

Coming to the food, all the dishes we tried were satisfying and flavorful. The menu offers a variety of options, and the quality was up to the mark. It’s a great spot if you’re looking to enjoy a meal without any specific complaints about taste or presentation.

The seating area was comfortable, and the ambience was another standout feature. The café has a cozy and well-lit vibe, perfect for catching up with friends or just relaxing with a cup of coffee.

In summary, Cafe Azzure is a solid choice if you’re in the MG Road area and looking for a calm and enjoyable café experience.
